[Poss. also *bōḍḍha -- sanskritized in bauḍhya -- vihāra -- m. ʻ name of an offering to the Rudras ʼ Gr̥S. -- Cf. *butta -- , *biḍḍa -- , *bhuṭṭa -- , and perh. buli -- : see list s.v. *bukka -- 4]
S. ḇuṭo ʻ wanting ears or horns or tail ʼ;
L. (Ju.) ḇuṭā ʻ one -- eared, hare -- lipped, unadorned, spoilt, cracked, chipped ʼ;
P. buṭṭ m. ʻ toothless gum ʼ, buṭṭā ʻ unadorned ʼ;
N. buṭo ʻ stump ʼ, (with emph. doubling) buṭṭo ʻ unadorned ʼ;
A. buṭā ʻ of short stature ʼ, buṭī ʻ worn -- out, blunt ʼ;
G. būṭ f. ʻ lobe of ear ʼ;
M. būṭ m. ʻ hammer -- headed shark ʼ, buṭkā ʻ broken -- tipped, dwarfish ʼ.
